newsitem.title: MEXICO: Pemex says eyeing lira, yankee bond markets.
newsitem.headline: Pemex says eyeing lira, yankee bond markets.

text.p: Officials from Mexico's state oil and gas monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) said on Tuesday the company is looking to place bonds in Italian liras or in U.S. dollars.

Corporate finance director Juan Manuel Romero said at a news conference that the company will probably place three debt issues totalling $800 million in 1997. The company will have $1.2 billion in maturing debt, he said.
"Next year we should have net debt programmed of $400 million," Pemex director general Adrian Lajous told reporters at a presentation of 1996 results.
Pemex is observing the markets for the best conditions, Romero added.

In April last year Pemex placed a two-year 300 billion lira bond with a yield of 300 basis points over U.S. Treasuries. The company may renew existing commercial and bank paper with paper at more attractive rates, he said.
